description: A seemingly uninhabited island in the New World located immediately north of Dressrosa. It features a giant, lush forest and numerous wrecked ships on its shores. The island's underground is home to the Tontatta Kingdom. Connected to Dressrosa by an iron bridge that has been closed for 200 years due to Fighting Fish.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Green Bit
keyEvents.description: Law's team successfully reaches Green Bit and discovers wrecked ships, a lush forest, and signs of Marine presence, raising suspicions about a potential ambush.
keyEvents.significance: The team reaches the exchange location but discovers concerning signs that suggest the exchange may not go as planned.

statusHistory.reason: Island is discovered and reached by Law's team

description: A massive iron bridge connecting Dressrosa to Green Bit. The bridge has been closed for 200 years due to the presence of aggressive Fighting Fish in the surrounding waters. The bridge is so sturdy that it can support the weight of multiple giant Fighting Fish, though it bends under their mass. It serves as the only direct route between the two islands.

keyEvents.title: Law's Team Begins Crossing to Green Bit
keyEvents.description: Law, Robin, Usopp, and Caesar begin crossing the dangerous iron bridge to reach Green Bit for the Caesar-Doflamingo exchange.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of a crucial and dangerous journey to the exchange location.

keyEvents.title: Fighting Fish Attack
keyEvents.description: A school of massive Fighting Fish attacks Law's team on the iron bridge, causing it to bend under their weight.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the danger of crossing to Green Bit and explains why the bridge has been closed for 200 years.

statusHistory.reason: Closed for 200 years due to Fighting Fish
Law's team crosses despite the danger

description: A massive gladiatorial arena located in Dressrosa where a tournament is being held to win the Mera Mera no Mi. The tournament features 556 participants divided into four blocks (A, B, C, D), with each block fighting in a battle royale format. Only one winner per block advances to the final round.

keyEvents.title: Bellamy Acknowledges Luffy's Growth
keyEvents.description: After being defeated in Block B, Bellamy encounters Luffy at the colosseum and acknowledges his growth in Haki.
keyEvents.significance: Shows character development for Bellamy and his complex relationship with Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Bartolomeo Discovers Luffy's Identity
keyEvents.description: Bartolomeo overhears Bellamy calling Luffy 'Straw Hat' and realizes his idol is at the colosseum.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Bartolomeo's connection to Luffy and his fanboy behavior.

keyEvents.title: Block C Fighters Introduction
keyEvents.description: The Block C fighters, including Hajrudin, Jean Ango, and Ucy, are introduced before their battle.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the upcoming Block C battle and introduces key characters.

description: A tropical island kingdom in the New World, currently ruled by Donquixote Doflamingo. Known for its passionate culture, love, toys, and the Corrida Colosseum. Connected to the northern island of Green Bit by an iron bridge.

keyEvents.title: Violet Betrays and Then Helps Sanji
keyEvents.description: Sanji's encounter with Violet leads to her betraying the Donquixote family to help the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Gains the Straw Hats a valuable ally with insider knowledge of Doflamingo's operations.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Uses Amour Shot
keyEvents.description: Sanji defeats Doflamingo's operatives in Dressrosa using his Amour Shot technique.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's combat abilities in the New World.
